description: In this study of African-Americans in U. S. society from African origins to the present,
students explore the African heritage, the experience of slavery, segregation, and the
rise of the Civil Rights movement of the 1960s.  The course pays particular attention to
the issue of black nationalism as a force in American life.  Offered periodically. Also counts
toward race and ethnic studies major and Africa and the African Diaspora and race and ethnic
